title: How to Make an Authentic Wooden Harry Potter Wand

steps.headline: The first thing to do when making a Harry Potter wand is to get a stick, either straight from a tree or one that's fallen off a tree.
steps.description: (Remember to cut of the extra bits and cut a little bit off the tip to straighten it up and it has to be about 1.5 cm thick or thicker).

steps.headline: Use a potato peeler to peel off all the bark until the stick is about 1.4 cm thick or a little thicker.
After that, make a small thin mark using a black marker on the place you wish to be as your base.
steps.description: Now use the potato peeler to peel off from the mark making it thinner than the base by about half the base's thickness or thinner.

steps.headline: Smooth up the wand using either a penknife or sandpaper, when you're done the base should be about 1.1 cm or less.
Now for the best bit, decorating!

steps.headline: Now cut the elastic band off the ring light and replace it with string and wrap it around the tip of the stick and now you have an illuminating Harry Potter wand!
Take the doweling, and cut to desired length.
Using the craft knife, whittle away a thin layer of wood.

steps.description: Continue whittling until the wand tapers the way you'd like it to.

tyn: A stick (It can be 10-16 inches long depends on whose wand you want to make)
Black/Brown paint (Depends if your going to paint your wand) *Permanent marker and a Black marker (Also Depends)
A stick of doweling rod (for alternate wand)
text: Steps The first thing to do when making a Harry Potter wand is to get a stick, either straight from a tree or one that's fallen off a tree. (Remember to cut of the extra bits and cut a little bit off the tip to straighten it up and it has to be about 1.5 cm thick or thicker). Use a potato peeler to peel off all the bark until the stick is about 1.4 cm thick or a little thicker.  After that, make a small thin mark using a black marker on the place you wish to be as your base. Now use the potato peeler to peel off from the mark making it thinner than the base by about half the base's thickness or thinner. Smooth up the wand using either a penknife or sandpaper, when you're done the base should be about 1.1 cm or less.  Now for the best bit, decorating! (If you're leaving your wand plain, skip to the next step) For example, if you're making Harry's wand, you'd paint the wand black until the mark then you'd paint the rest brown or if you don't have paint, you can use a black marker to color the stick in and then use the permanent marker as a second layer then add either varnish, olive oil or baby oil to give it a shine. Now cut the elastic band off the ring light and replace it with string and wrap it around the tip of the stick and now you have an illuminating Harry Potter wand!  Alternative Method Take the doweling, and cut to desired length.  Using the craft knife, whittle away a thin layer of wood.  Keep whittling! Continue whittling until the wand tapers the way you'd like it to.
